private_information: I can manipulate vowels: A, E, I
I can hold at most one block at a time
I can only pick up top blocks of stacks
I cannot place a block onto a block that another agent is currently holding
vowel_agent.goal: Cooperate to rearrange blocks so final stacks are F-C-I-G and A-B-D-E, while respecting interaction and safety constraints.

private_information: I can manipulate consonants: B, C, D, F, G
I can hold at most one block at a time
I can only pick up top blocks of stacks
I cannot place a block onto a block that another agent is currently holding
consonant_agent.goal: Cooperate to rearrange blocks so final stacks are F-C-I-G and A-B-D-E, while respecting interaction and safety constraints.

orchestrator.goal: Coordinate vowel_agent and consonant_agent to produce a valid plan (PDDL domain and problem) that achieves the goal stacks while enforcing all constraints (capabilities, holds, top-only moves, max 3 stacks).

public_information: Blocks rest on the table or on other blocks forming stacks.
Only top blocks of stacks are movable.
An agent may hold at most one block at a time.
If one agent is holding a block, the other agent cannot place a block on top of that held block.
Placing a block on the table creates a new stack (increasing num_stacks).
Total number of stacks on the table must never exceed 3.
No blocks exist beyond A, B, C, D, E, F, G, I.

orchestrator.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and planning. You will be provided initial environment state, public facts, and private constraints for two agents (vowel_agent and consonant_agent). Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that captures the blocks world with stacks, agents' capabilities (which blocks each agent may manipulate), holds (each agent can hold at most one block), top-only moves, prohibition on placing on a block currently held by the other agent, and a global constraint that the number of stacks on the table never exceeds 3. Keep actions distinct per agent (e.g., pick-vowel, place-consonant). Return only the PDDL domain and problem enclosed respectively in <domain>...</domain> and <problem>...</problem> tags with no additional commentary.
orchestrator.prompt:
Your name is orchestrator.
Initial information about the environment (init): {environment->init}.
Goal for the environment: {environment->goal}.
Public information: {environment->public_information}.
Vowel agent constraints and private info: {agents->agent_details->vowel_agent->private_information}.
Consonant agent constraints and private info: {agents->agent_details->consonant_agent->private_information}.
Generate a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that models this multi-agent block rearrangement task exactly, enforcing all stated constraints (including max 3 stacks invariant) and agent capabilities. Do not assume anything not provided. Provide only the domain and problem files between the specified tags.
